74 #ifdef TEUCHOS_MPI_COMM_DUMP
75 template<typename Ordinal, typename T>
76 void dumpBuffer(
77  const std::string &funcName, const std::string &buffName
78  ,const Ordinal bytes, const T buff[]
79  )
80 {
81  Teuchos::RCP<Teuchos::FancyOStream>
82  out = Teuchos::VerboseObjectBase::getDefaultOStream();
83  Teuchos::OSTab tab(out);
84  *out
85  << "\n" << funcName << "::" << buffName << ":\n";
86  tab.incrTab();
87  for( Ordinal i = 0; i < bytes; ++i ) {
88  *out << buffName << "[" << i << "] = '" << buff[i] << "'\n";
89  }
90  *out << "\n";
91 }
92 #endif // TEUCHOS_MPI_COMM_DUMP

105 class MpiCommRequest : public CommRequest {

109  const ArrayView<char>::size_type numBytesInMessage) :
110  rawMpiRequest_ (rawMpiRequest), numBytes_ (numBytesInMessage)
111  {}
112 
119  MPI_Request releaseRawMpiRequest()
120  {
121  MPI_Request tmp_rawMpiRequest = rawMpiRequest_;
122  rawMpiRequest_ = MPI_REQUEST_NULL;

125 
127  bool isNull() const {
128  return rawMpiRequest_ == MPI_REQUEST_NULL;

137  return numBytes_;

435 template<typename Ordinal>
436 MpiComm<Ordinal>::MpiComm(
437  const RCP<const OpaqueWrapper<MPI_Comm> > &rawMpiComm
438  )
439 {
440  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(rawMpiComm.get()==NULL, std::invalid_argument,
441  "Teuchos::MpiComm constructor: The input RCP is null.");
442  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(*rawMpiComm == MPI_COMM_NULL,
443  std::invalid_argument, "Teuchos::MpiComm constructor: The given MPI_Comm "
444  "is MPI_COMM_NULL.");
445  rawMpiComm_ = rawMpiComm;
446 
447  // FIXME (mfh 26 Mar 2012) The following is a bit wicked in that it
448  // changes the behavior of existing applications that use MpiComm,
449  // without warning. I've chosen to do it because I can't figure out
450  // any other way to help me debug MPI_Waitall failures on some (but
451  // not all) of the testing platforms. The problem is that MPI's
452  // default error handler is MPI_ERRORS_ARE_FATAL, which immediately
453  // aborts on error without returning an error code from the MPI
454  // function. Also, the testing platforms' MPI implementations'
455  // diagnostics are not giving me useful information. Thus, I'm
456  // setting the default error handler to MPI_ERRORS_RETURN, so that
457  // MPI_Waitall will return an error code.
458  //
459  // Note that all MpiComm methods check error codes returned by MPI
460  // functions, and throw an exception if the code is not MPI_SUCCESS.
461  // Thus, this change in behavior will only affect your program in
462  // the following case: You call a function f() in the try block of a
463  // try-catch, and expect f() to throw an exception (generally
464  // std::runtime_error) in a particular case not related to MpiComm,
465  // but MpiComm throws the exception instead. It's probably a bad
466  // idea for you to do this, because MpiComm might very well throw
467  // exceptions for things like invalid arguments.
468  const bool makeMpiErrorsReturn = true;
469  if (makeMpiErrorsReturn) {
470  RCP<const OpaqueWrapper<MPI_Errhandler> > errHandler =
471  rcp (new OpaqueWrapper<MPI_Errhandler> (MPI_ERRORS_RETURN));
472  setErrorHandler (errHandler);
473  }
474 
475  setupMembersFromComm();
476 }
477 
478 
479 template<typename Ordinal>
480 MpiComm<Ordinal>::MpiComm(const MpiComm<Ordinal>& other)
481 {
482  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(other.getRawMpiComm().get() == NULL);
483  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(*other.getRawMpiComm() == MPI_COMM_NULL);
484  MPI_Comm newComm;
485  const int err = MPI_Comm_dup (*other.getRawMpiComm(), &newComm);
486  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::runtime_error,
487  "Teuchos::MpiComm copy constructor: MPI_Comm_dup failed with error \""
488  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
489  rawMpiComm_ = opaqueWrapper (newComm,MPI_Comm_free);
490  setupMembersFromComm();
491 }

494 template<typename Ordinal>
495 void MpiComm<Ordinal>::setupMembersFromComm()
496 {
497  MPI_Comm_size(*rawMpiComm_, &size_);
498  MPI_Comm_rank(*rawMpiComm_, &rank_);
499  if(tagCounter_ > maxTag_)
500  tagCounter_ = minTag_;
501  tag_ = tagCounter_++;
502 }

505 template<typename Ordinal>
506 void
507 MpiComm<Ordinal>::
508 setErrorHandler (const RCP<const OpaqueWrapper<MPI_Errhandler> >& errHandler)
509 {
510  if (! is_null (errHandler)) {
511  const int err = MPI_Comm_set_errhandler (*getRawMpiComm(), *errHandler);
512  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::runtime_error,
513  "Teuchos::MpiComm::setErrorHandler: MPI_Comm_set_errhandler() failed with "
514  "error \"" << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
515  }
516  // Wait to set this until the end, in case MPI_Errhandler_set()
517  // doesn't succeed.
518  customErrorHandler_ = errHandler;
519 }

568 template<typename Ordinal>
569 void MpiComm<Ordinal>::gatherAll(
570  const Ordinal sendBytes, const char sendBuffer[],
571  const Ordinal recvBytes, char recvBuffer[]
572  ) const
573 {
574  TEUCHOS_COMM_TIME_MONITOR(
575  "Teuchos::MpiComm<"<<OrdinalTraits<Ordinal>::name()<<">::gatherAll(...)"
576  );
577  TEUCHOS_ASSERT_EQUALITY((sendBytes*size_), recvBytes );
578  const int err =
579  MPI_Allgather (const_cast<char *>(sendBuffer), sendBytes, MPI_CHAR,
580  recvBuffer, sendBytes, MPI_CHAR, *rawMpiComm_);
581  // NOTE: 'sendBytes' is being sent above for the MPI arg recvcount (which is
582  // very confusing in the MPI documentation) for MPI_Allgether(...).
583 
584  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::runtime_error,
585  "Teuchos::MpiComm::gatherAll: MPI_Allgather failed with error \""
586  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
587 }

590 template<typename Ordinal>
591 void
592 MpiComm<Ordinal>::
593 reduceAll (const ValueTypeReductionOp<Ordinal,char> &reductOp,
594  const Ordinal bytes,
595  const char sendBuffer[],
596  char globalReducts[]) const
597 {
598  TEUCHOS_COMM_TIME_MONITOR( "Teuchos::MpiComm::reduceAll(...)" );
599 
600  MpiReductionOpSetter op(mpiReductionOp(rcp(&reductOp,false)));
601  MPI_Datatype char_block;
602 
603  // TODO (mfh 26 Mar 2012) Check returned error codes of the MPI
604  // custom datatype functions.
605  MPI_Type_contiguous(bytes, MPI_CHAR, &char_block);
606  MPI_Type_commit(&char_block);
607 
608  const int err =
609  MPI_Allreduce (const_cast<char*>(sendBuffer), globalReducts, 1, char_block,
610  op.mpi_op(), *rawMpiComm_);
611  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::runtime_error,
612  "Teuchos::MpiComm::reduceAll (custom op): MPI_Allreduce failed with error \""
613  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
614 
615  // TODO (mfh 26 Mar 2012) Check returned error codes of the MPI
616  // custom datatype functions.
617  MPI_Type_free(&char_block);
618 }

621 template<typename Ordinal>
622 void MpiComm<Ordinal>::reduceAllAndScatter(
623  const ValueTypeReductionOp<Ordinal,char> &reductOp
624  ,const Ordinal sendBytes, const char sendBuffer[]
625  ,const Ordinal recvCounts[], char myGlobalReducts[]
626  ) const
627 {
628 
629  (void)sendBytes; // Ignore if not in debug mode
630 
631  TEUCHOS_COMM_TIME_MONITOR(
632  "Teuchos::MpiComm<"<<OrdinalTraits<Ordinal>::name()<<">::reduceAllAndScatter(...)"
633  );
634 
635 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
636  Ordinal sumRecvBytes = 0;
637  for( Ordinal i = 0; i < size_; ++i ) {
638  sumRecvBytes += recvCounts[i];
639  }
640  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(!(sumRecvBytes==sendBytes));
641 #endif // TEUCHOS_DEBUG
642 
643 #ifdef TEUCHOS_MPI_COMM_DUMP
644  if(show_dump) {
645  dumpBuffer<Ordinal,char>(
646  "Teuchos::MpiComm<Ordinal>::reduceAllAndScatter(...)",
647  "sendBuffer", sendBytes, sendBuffer );
648  dumpBuffer<Ordinal,Ordinal>(
649  "Teuchos::MpiComm<Ordinal>::reduceAllAndScatter(...)",
650  "recvCounts", as<Ordinal>(size_), recvCounts );
651  dumpBuffer<Ordinal,char>(
652  "Teuchos::MpiComm<Ordinal>::reduceAllAndScatter(...)",
653  "myGlobalReducts", as<char>(recvCounts[rank_]), myGlobalReducts );
654  }
655 #endif // TEUCHOS_MPI_COMM_DUMP
656 
657  // Create a new recvCount[] if Ordinal!=int
658  WorkspaceStore* wss = get_default_workspace_store().get();
659  const bool Ordinal_is_int = typeid(int)==typeid(Ordinal);
660  Workspace<int> ws_int_recvCounts(wss,Ordinal_is_int?0:size_);
661  const int *int_recvCounts = 0;
662  if(Ordinal_is_int) {
663  int_recvCounts = reinterpret_cast<const int*>(recvCounts);
664  // Note: We must do an reinterpet cast since this must
665  // compile even if it is not executed. I could implement
666  // code that would not need to do this using template
667  // conditionals but I don't want to bother.
668  }
669  else {
670  std::copy(recvCounts, recvCounts+size_, &ws_int_recvCounts[0]);
671  int_recvCounts = &ws_int_recvCounts[0];
672  }
673 
674  // Perform the operation
675  MpiReductionOpSetter op(mpiReductionOp(rcp(&reductOp, false)));
676 
677  const int err = MPI_Reduce_scatter(
678  const_cast<char*>(sendBuffer), myGlobalReducts,
679  const_cast<int*>(int_recvCounts),
680  MPI_CHAR,
681  op.mpi_op(),
682  *rawMpiComm_
683  );
684  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::runtime_error,
685  "Teuchos::MpiComm::reduceAllAndScatter: MPI_Reduce_scatter failed with "
686  "error \"" << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
687 }

786 MpiComm<Ordinal>::receive (const int sourceRank,
787  const Ordinal bytes,
788  char recvBuffer[]) const
789 {
790  TEUCHOS_COMM_TIME_MONITOR( "Teuchos::MpiComm::receive(...)" );
791 
792  // A negative source rank indicates MPI_ANY_SOURCE, namely that we
793  // will take an incoming message from any process, as long as the
794  // tag matches.
795  const int theSrcRank = (sourceRank < 0) ? MPI_ANY_SOURCE : sourceRank;
796 
797  MPI_Status status;
798  const int err = MPI_Recv (recvBuffer, bytes, MPI_CHAR, theSrcRank, tag_,
799  *rawMpiComm_, &status);
800  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::runtime_error,
801  "Teuchos::MpiComm::receive: MPI_Recv() failed with error \""
802  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
803 
804 #ifdef TEUCHOS_MPI_COMM_DUMP
805  if (show_dump) {
806  dumpBuffer<Ordinal,char> ("Teuchos::MpiComm<Ordinal>::receive(...)",
807  "recvBuffer", bytes, recvBuffer);
808  }
809 #endif // TEUCHOS_MPI_COMM_DUMP
810 
811  // Returning the source rank is useful in the MPI_ANY_SOURCE case.
812  return status.MPI_SOURCE;
813 }

859 namespace {
860  // Called by both MpiComm::waitAll() implementations.
861  template<typename Ordinal>
862  void
863  waitAllImpl (const ArrayView<RCP<CommRequest> >& requests,
864  const ArrayView<MPI_Status>& rawMpiStatuses)
865  {
866  typedef ArrayView<RCP<CommRequest> >::size_type size_type;
867  const size_type count = requests.size();
868  // waitAllImpl() is not meant to be called by users, so it's a bug
869  // for the two views to have different lengths.
870  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(rawMpiStatuses.size() != count,
871  std::logic_error, "Teuchos::MpiComm's waitAllImpl: rawMpiStatus.size() = "
872  << rawMpiStatuses.size() << " != requests.size() = " << requests.size()
873  << ". Please report this bug to the Tpetra developers.");
874  if (count == 0) {
875  return; // No requests on which to wait
876  }
877 
878  // MpiComm wraps MPI and can't expose any MPI structs or opaque
879  // objects. Thus, we have to unpack requests into a separate array.
880  // If that's too slow, then your code should just call into MPI
881  // directly.
882  //
883  // Pull out the raw MPI requests from the wrapped requests.
884  // MPI_Waitall should not fail if a request is MPI_REQUEST_NULL, but
885  // we keep track just to inform the user.
886  bool someNullRequests = false;
887  Array<MPI_Request> rawMpiRequests (count, MPI_REQUEST_NULL);
888  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
889  RCP<CommRequest> request = requests[i];
890  if (! is_null (request)) {
891  RCP<MpiCommRequest> mpiRequest =
892  rcp_dynamic_cast<MpiCommRequest> (request);
893  // releaseRawMpiRequest() sets the MpiCommRequest's raw
894  // MPI_Request to MPI_REQUEST_NULL. This makes waitAll() not
895  // satisfy the strong exception guarantee. That's OK because
896  // MPI_Waitall() doesn't promise that it satisfies the strong
897  // exception guarantee, and we would rather conservatively
898  // invalidate the handles than leave dangling requests around
899  // and risk users trying to wait on the same request twice.
900  rawMpiRequests[i] = mpiRequest->releaseRawMpiRequest();
901  }
902  else { // Null requests map to MPI_REQUEST_NULL
903  rawMpiRequests[i] = MPI_REQUEST_NULL;
904  someNullRequests = true;
905  }
906  }
907 
908  // This is the part where we've finally peeled off the wrapper and
909  // we can now interact with MPI directly.
910  //
911  // One option in the one-argument version of waitAll() is to ignore
912  // the statuses completely. MPI lets you pass in the named constant
913  // MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE for the MPI_Status array output argument in
914  // MPI_Waitall(), which would tell MPI not to bother with the
915  // statuses. However, we want the statuses because we can use them
916  // for detailed error diagnostics in case something goes wrong.
917  const int err = MPI_Waitall (count, rawMpiRequests.getRawPtr(),
918  rawMpiStatuses.getRawPtr());
919 
920  // In MPI_Waitall(), an error indicates that one or more requests
921  // failed. In that case, there could be requests that completed
922  // (their MPI_Status' error field is MPI_SUCCESS), and other
923  // requests that have not completed yet but have not necessarily
924  // failed (MPI_PENDING). We make no attempt here to wait on the
925  // pending requests. It doesn't make sense for us to do so, because
926  // in general Teuchos::Comm doesn't attempt to provide robust
927  // recovery from failed messages.
928  if (err != MPI_SUCCESS) {
929  if (err == MPI_ERR_IN_STATUS) {
930  //
931  // When MPI_Waitall returns MPI_ERR_IN_STATUS (a standard error
932  // class), it's telling us to check the error codes in the
933  // returned statuses. In that case, we do so and generate a
934  // detailed exception message.
935  //
936  // Figure out which of the requests failed.
937  Array<std::pair<size_type, int> > errorLocationsAndCodes;
938  for (size_type k = 0; k < rawMpiStatuses.size(); ++k) {
939  const int curErr = rawMpiStatuses[k].MPI_ERROR;
940  if (curErr != MPI_SUCCESS) {
941  errorLocationsAndCodes.push_back (std::make_pair (k, curErr));
942  }
943  }
944  const size_type numErrs = errorLocationsAndCodes.size();
945  if (numErrs > 0) {
946  // There was at least one error. Assemble a detailed
947  // exception message reporting which requests failed,
948  // their error codes, and their source
949  std::ostringstream os;
950  os << "Teuchos::MpiComm::waitAll: MPI_Waitall() failed with error \""
951  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\". Of the " << count
952  << " total request" << (count != 1 ? "s" : "") << ", " << numErrs
953  << " failed. Here are the indices of the failed requests, and the "
954  "error codes extracted from their returned MPI_Status objects:"
955  << std::endl;
956  for (size_type k = 0; k < numErrs; ++k) {
957  const size_type errInd = errorLocationsAndCodes[k].first;
958  os << "Request " << errInd << ": MPI_ERROR = "
959  << mpiErrorCodeToString (rawMpiStatuses[errInd].MPI_ERROR)
960  << std::endl;
961  }
962  if (someNullRequests) {
963  os << " On input to MPI_Waitall, there was at least one MPI_"
964  "Request that was MPI_REQUEST_NULL. MPI_Waitall should not "
965  "normally fail in that case, but we thought we should let you know "
966  "regardless.";
967  }
968  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(true, std::runtime_error, os.str());
969  }
970  // If there were no actual errors in the returned statuses,
971  // well, then I guess everything is OK. Just keep going.
972  }
973  else {
974  std::ostringstream os;
975  os << "Teuchos::MpiComm::waitAll: MPI_Waitall() failed with error \""
976  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".";
977  if (someNullRequests) {
978  os << " On input to MPI_Waitall, there was at least one MPI_Request "
979  "that was MPI_REQUEST_NULL. MPI_Waitall should not normally fail in "
980  "that case, but we thought we should let you know regardless.";
981  }
982  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(true, std::runtime_error, os.str());
983  }
984  }
985 
986 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_DEBUG
987  if (false) // mfh 02 Apr 2012: This test fails in some cases (e.g., Belos BlockCG), with the MPI_Request reporting 8 bytes and the MPI_Status reporting 0 bytes. The tests pass otherwise, so I'm disabling this check for now.
988  {
989  // In debug mode, test whether the requests' message lengths
990  // matched the message lengths on completion.
991  Array<size_type> nonmatchingIndices;
992  Array<std::pair<size_type, size_type> > nonmatchingLengthPairs;
993  for (size_type k = 0; k < count; ++k) {
994  if (! is_null (requests[k])) {
995  RCP<MpiCommRequest> mpiRequest =
996  rcp_dynamic_cast<MpiCommRequest> (requests[k]);
997 
998  int statusCount = -1;
999  (void) MPI_Get_count (&rawMpiStatuses[k], MPI_CHAR, &statusCount);
1000  if (mpiRequest->numBytes() != as<size_type> (statusCount)) {
1001  nonmatchingIndices.push_back (k);
1002  nonmatchingLengthPairs.push_back (std::make_pair (mpiRequest->numBytes(), Teuchos::as<size_type> (statusCount)));
1003  }
1004  }
1005  }
1006  const size_type numNonmatching = nonmatchingIndices.size();
1007  if (numNonmatching > 0) {
1008  std::ostringstream os;
1009  os << "Teuchos::MpiComm::waitAll(): " << numNonmatching << " message "
1010  "request" << (numNonmatching != 1 ? "s" : "") << " have a number of "
1011  "bytes which does not match the number of bytes in "
1012  << (numNonmatching != 1 ? "their" : "its") << " corresponding status"
1013  << (numNonmatching != 1 ? "es" : "") << "." << std::endl;
1014  os << "Here are the lengths that don't match (from MPI_Request, MPI_Status resp.): " << std::endl;
1015  for (Array<std::pair<size_type, size_type> >::const_iterator it = nonmatchingLengthPairs.begin(); it != nonmatchingLengthPairs.end(); ++it) {
1016  os << "(" << it->first << "," << it->second << ") ";
1017  }
1018  if (err == MPI_ERR_IN_STATUS) {
1019  os << std::endl << "This is that weird case where MPI_Waitall returned MPI_ERR_IN_STATUS, but all of the MPI_Statuses' error codes were MPI_SUCCESS.";
1020  }
1021  // This is a bug, so we throw std::logic_error.
1022  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(numNonmatching > 0, std::logic_error, os.str());
1023  }
1024  }
1025 #endif // HAVE_TEUCHOS_DEBUG
1026 
1027  // Invalidate the input array of requests by setting all entries to
1028  // null.
1029  std::fill (requests.begin(), requests.end(), null);
1030  }
1031 } // namespace (anonymous)

1047 template<typename Ordinal>
1048 void
1049 MpiComm<Ordinal>::
1050 waitAll (const ArrayView<RCP<CommRequest> >& requests,
1051  const ArrayView<RCP<CommStatus<Ordinal> > >& statuses) const
1052 {
1053  TEUCHOS_COMM_TIME_MONITOR( "Teuchos::MpiComm::waitAll(requests, statuses)" );
1054 
1055  typedef ArrayView<RCP<CommRequest> >::size_type size_type;
1056  const size_type count = requests.size();
1057 
1058  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(count != statuses.size(),
1059  std::invalid_argument, "Teuchos::MpiComm::waitAll: requests.size() = "
1060  << count << " != statuses.size() = " << statuses.size() << ".");
1061 
1062  Array<MPI_Status> rawMpiStatuses (count);
1063  waitAllImpl<Ordinal> (requests, rawMpiStatuses());
1064 
1065  // Repackage the raw MPI_Status structs into the wrappers.
1066  for (size_type i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
1067  statuses[i] = mpiCommStatus<Ordinal> (rawMpiStatuses[i]);
1068  }

1072 template<typename Ordinal>
1073 RCP<CommStatus<Ordinal> >
1074 MpiComm<Ordinal>::wait (const Ptr<RCP<CommRequest> >& request) const
1075 {
1076  TEUCHOS_COMM_TIME_MONITOR( "Teuchos::MpiComm::wait(...)" );
1077 
1078  if (is_null(*request)) {
1079  return null; // Nothing to wait on ...
1080  }
1081  const RCP<MpiCommRequest> mpiCommRequest =
1082  rcp_dynamic_cast<MpiCommRequest>(*request);
1083  // This function doesn't satisfy the strong exception guarantee,
1084  // because releaseRawMpiRequest() modifies the MpiCommRequest.
1085  MPI_Request rawMpiRequest = mpiCommRequest->releaseRawMpiRequest();
1086  MPI_Status status;
1087  const int err = MPI_Wait (&rawMpiRequest, &status);
1088  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::runtime_error,
1089  "Teuchos::MpiComm::wait: MPI_Wait() failed with error \""
1090  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
1091 
1092  *request = null;
1093  return rcp (new MpiCommStatus<Ordinal> (status));
1094 }

1131 template<typename Ordinal>
1132 RCP< Comm<Ordinal> >
1133 MpiComm<Ordinal>::createSubcommunicator(const ArrayView<const int> &ranks) const
1134 {
1135  int err = MPI_SUCCESS; // For error codes returned by MPI functions
1136 
1137  // Get the group that this communicator is in.
1138  MPI_Group thisGroup;
1139  err = MPI_Comm_group(*rawMpiComm_, &thisGroup);
1140  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::logic_error,
1141  "Failed to obtain the current communicator's group. "
1142  "MPI_Comm_group failed with error \""
1143  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
1144 
1145  // Create a new group with the specified members.
1146  MPI_Group newGroup;
1147  // It's rude to cast away const, but MPI functions demand it.
1148  //
1149  // NOTE (mfh 14 Aug 2012) Please don't ask for &ranks[0] unless you
1150  // know that ranks.size() > 0. That's why I'm using getRawPtr().
1151  err = MPI_Group_incl (thisGroup, ranks.size(),
1152  const_cast<int*> (ranks.getRawPtr ()), &newGroup);
1153  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::logic_error,
1154  "Failed to create subgroup. MPI_Group_incl failed with error \""
1155  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
1156 
1157  // Create a new communicator from the new group.
1158  MPI_Comm newComm;
1159  try {
1160  err = MPI_Comm_create(*rawMpiComm_, newGroup, &newComm);
1161  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::logic_error,
1162  "Failed to create subcommunicator. MPI_Comm_create failed with error \""
1163  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
1164  } catch (...) {
1165  // Attempt to free the new group before rethrowing. If
1166  // successful, this will prevent a memory leak due to the "lost"
1167  // group that was allocated successfully above. Since we're
1168  // throwing std::logic_error anyway, we can only promise
1169  // best-effort recovery; thus, we don't check the error code.
1170  (void) MPI_Group_free (&newGroup);
1171  (void) MPI_Group_free (&thisGroup);
1172  throw;
1173  }
1174 
1175  // We don't need the group any more, so free it.
1176  err = MPI_Group_free (&newGroup);
1177  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::logic_error,
1178  "Failed to free subgroup. MPI_Group_free failed with error \""
1179  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
1180  err = MPI_Group_free (&thisGroup);
1181  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(err != MPI_SUCCESS, std::logic_error,
1182  "Failed to free subgroup. MPI_Group_free failed with error \""
1183  << mpiErrorCodeToString (err) << "\".");
1184 
1185  if (newComm == MPI_COMM_NULL) {
1186  return RCP< Comm<Ordinal> >();
1187  } else {
1188  return rcp(new MpiComm<Ordinal>(
1189  rcp_implicit_cast<const OpaqueWrapper<MPI_Comm> >(
1190  opaqueWrapper(newComm,MPI_Comm_free))));
1191  }
1192 }
